An inattentive admin leaked half of their RSA private key on a public forum. Can you use this partial exposure to recover the original message from 1551208790858885222201946005768969570360720688866899145368414242173800599232971107351424491960711758101075472114231606933035275423746264914626316237005183?

The flag format is flag{...}
n=5729179245698822589027421374120433869946104965712804983316947051976481574297805095755910250076520246321176077604048782624687757639063072887999888936971249, e=4243635103583680299013230612910837390609637867658315017185046985574988084956810820929381483396799664763340004668978968156091255029366792228057145965377161, partial_p=10954955759510353226

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{0abnv7se}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 1551208790858885222201946005768969570360720688866899145368414242173800599232971107351424491960711758101075472114231606933035275423746264914626316237005183
vulnerability: partial key exposure
hint: A partial exposure of a prime number's bits can significantly weaken RSA security. Look into lattice-based techniques like Coppersmith's attack.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=5729179245698822589027421374120433869946104965712804983316947051976481574297805095755910250076520246321176077604048782624687757639063072887999888936971249, e=4243635103583680299013230612910837390609637867658315017185046985574988084956810820929381483396799664763340004668978968156091255029366792228057145965377161, partial_p=10954955759510353226
extra_info: p=68765371809106751648099615582380984407552032008867377245490288278802412683589, q=83314887929393767868280178627100084958700263040651556473288894600235575626941, Ï†(n)=5729179245698822589027421374120433869946104965712804983316947051976481574297653015496171749557003866526966596534682530329638238705344293705120850948660720
